Description: A SAFe RTE (Scaled Agile Framework Release Train Engineer) is responsible for coordinating and managing the Agile Release Train (ART) processes and programs in a SAFe enterprise. They work closely with the Agile teams and stakeholders to facilitate effective communication, collaboration, and alignment between teams, and ensure that the ART delivers value to the organization in a timely and effective manner. The SAFe RTE is also responsible for ensuring the continuous improvement of the ART and the SAFe implementation across the organization, while working to resolve any issues or impediments that may arise. They are a key member of the SAFe leadership team and play a critical role in driving the success of the SAFe transformation within the organization.

Required.SkillDescription: Strong understanding of Agile and SAFe methodologies and experience in implementing and managing these practices at the enterprise level
Experience in release train planning and execution, including the ability to coordinate multiple Agile teams and to manage dependencies across teams and systems
Ability to facilitate and coach Agile and SAFe practices, and to provide guidance and leadership to the Agile teams and stakeholders
Experience in team building and leadership, including the ability to motivate and inspire team members, and to build a collaborative and high-performing team
Ability to identify and solve problems, and to resolve conflicts within the team and across teams
Ability to identify areas for improvement and to facilitate continuous improvement at the enterprise level

Recommended.SkillDescription: Certification in SAFe methodologies, such as SAFe Release Train Engineer (RTE), SAFe Program Consultant (SPC), or SAFe Agilist (SA)
Experience in Lean-Agile leadership, including the ability to drive organizational change and to build a Lean-Agile culture
Understanding of project management principles and techniques, and the ability to apply these principles and techniques to the SAFe context
Understanding of business concepts and the ability to align Agile and SAFe practices with business objectives
Understanding of technical concepts and the ability to communicate effectively with technical team members and stakeholders
Understanding of risk management principles and techniques, and the ability to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with Agile and SAFe practices
Ability to analyze data and metrics related to the Agile and SAFe process, and to use this information to improve team performance and business outcomes
Understanding of DevOps practices and their integration with Agile and SAFe practices, and the ability to work effectively with DevOps teams
Understanding of Big Data technologies and the ability to apply Agile and SAFe practices to Big Data projects
Knowledge of artificial intelligence (AI) techniques and the ability to apply these techniques to improve team performance and business outcomes
Understanding of Internet of Things (IoT) technologies and the ability to apply Agile and SAFe practices to IoT projects
Understanding of User Experience (UX) design principles and the ability to work effectively with UX designers to improve the user experience of products and applications
Understanding of data science concepts and the ability to work effectively with data scientists to improve the data-driven decision-making of teams and organizations
Experience in implementing SAFe at the enterprise level, and the ability to customize and tailor SAFe practices to the specific needs and context of the organization
Experience in managing vendors and external partners, and the ability to ensure that vendors and partners adhere to Agile and SAFe practices and standards
Understanding of program management principles and techniques, and the ability to manage large-scale programs and initiatives within the SAFe context
Understanding of portfolio management principles and techniques, and the ability to align Agile and SAFe practices with portfolio objectives and strategies
